reviewText:
Needed to correct another reviewer to share that the visual quality is magnificent given the age of the initial horrific subject matter.  I popped the disc in my blu ray drive and the computer states that it is 22 GB of data.  This is profoundly more than the 4.7 GB of a DVD.

Content excellent as well.  I felt very lucky to stumble across this English Holocaust DVD on amazon.

I love this powerful film, and gave the DVD a five star review.

But this blu-ray has forced French subtitles that can't be turned off.  Also, the visual quality is really no better than the DVD to my eye.  Since almost all the footage is old and low resolution, there isn't much of a difference between the two.  Beyond that, it looked to my eyel the blu-ray had aded visual artifacts I never noticed in the DVD.

So unless you speak French only, you're much better off with the regular DVD version.
